headlines.description: Romain Saiss bundled home from close range to earn Wolves a 1-1 draw at Fulham on Wednesday and deny Claudio Ranieri's side a victory.
headlines.shortLinkText: Wolves hit late equaliser to deny Fulham

headlines.description: Everton ended their five-game winless run in emphatic fashion by drubbing relegation-threatened Burnley 5-1 at Turf Moor on Wednesday.
headlines.shortLinkText: Everton ended winless run with rout of  Burnley

headlines.description: Lowly Cardiff City survived intense pressure from Crystal Palace to pick up just their second away point of the season.
headlines.shortLinkText: Cardiff hold off Crystal Palace to save point

headlines.description: Manchester City suffered their second straight Premier League defeat as they were stunned by a late strike from Leicester City's Ricardo Pereira.
headlines.shortLinkText: Man City slip to third after Pereira stunner

headlines.description: Liverpool treated their fans to some Christmas cheer with a 4-0 thrashing of Newcastle United at Anfield.
headlines.shortLinkText: Liverpool six clear after Newcastle thrashing

headlines.description: Ole Gunnar Solskjaer continued his dream start as Manchester United caretaker manager with a 3-1 Premier League win over Huddersfield.
headlines.shortLinkText: Pogba double gives Solskjaer winning home debut

headlines.description: Tottenham Hotspur delivered a Boxing Day knockout to Bournemouth with a 5-0 win in the Premier League.
headlines.shortLinkText: Spurs hammer Bournemouth as Son nets double

headlines.description: Arsenal now have just one win in their past four matches after Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang's opener was cancelled out to earn Brighton a 1-1 draw.
headlines.shortLinkText: Arsenal drop points at Brighton with draw

headlines.description: The brace on Boxing Day gives the Belgian 101 goals for his Blues career, and keeps Chelsea in fourth place above Arsenal.
headlines.shortLinkText: Hazard passes century mark in Chelsea win
